title: Hover-over names
text:
Preface
Let’s talk about the bootstrap! (Efron 1979, 2003; Davison and Hinkley 1997; Efron and Hastie 2016)
It’s a resampling methodology originally created to compute the sampling distribution of statistics using minimal probabilistic assumptions.




Davison, A, and D Hinkley. 1997. Bootstrap Methods and Their Application. Cambridge University Press.


Efron, B. 1979. “Bootstrap Methods: Another Look at the Jackknife.” The Annals of Statistics 7 (1): 1–26.


———. 2003. “Second Thoughts on the Bootstrap.” Statistical Science, 135–40.


Efron, B, and T Hastie. 2016. Computer Age Statistical Inference. Cambridge University Press.
